title: How to Make Oreo Pudding Poke Cake

steps.headline: Bake the cake in a 9x13 inch (22cm x 28cm) baking pan.
steps.description: Use the original directions or instructions according to the recipe of your choice. Set the cake aside to cool completely.

steps.headline: Make the pudding.
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine the milk and pudding. Whisk the mixture until smooth.

steps.headline: Make the holes in the cake.
steps.description: Use the round tip at the end of a wooden spoon to create evenly portioned holes throughout the entire cake.

steps.headline: Fill the holes with the pudding.
steps.description: Pour the pudding over the cake, filling in the holes as best as you can.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the crushed Oreos on top.
steps.description: Distribute the Oreos evenly, covering the cake.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the cake until it's ready to be served.
steps.description: Use plastic wrap to cover the cake and place it in the refrigerator to chill for a few hours. This allows the filling to absorb into the cake.

text: Bake the cake in a 9x13 inch (22cm x 28cm) baking pan. Use the original directions or instructions according to the recipe of your choice. Set the cake aside to cool completely. Make the pudding. In a large bowl, combine the milk and pudding. Whisk the mixture until smooth. Make the holes in the cake. Use the round tip at the end of a wooden spoon to create evenly portioned holes throughout the entire cake. Fill the holes with the pudding. Pour the pudding over the cake, filling in the holes as best as you can. Sprinkle the crushed Oreos on top. Distribute the Oreos evenly, covering the cake. Refrigerate the cake until it's ready to be served. Use plastic wrap to cover the cake and place it in the refrigerator to chill for a few hours. This allows the filling to absorb into the cake.
